item.title: 德雷克唱片公司称应驳回对拉马尔的《Not Like Us》提起的诉讼
item.description: 德雷克（Drake）的长期唱片公司环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）周一要求驳回他因推广肯德里克-拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar）的格莱美获奖单曲《不像我们》（Not Like Us）而提起的诽谤诉讼。【原文：Drake's longtime label Universal Music Group on Monday sought a dismissal of his defamation lawsuit over its promotion of Kendrick Lamar's Grammy-winning single "Not Like Us," the biggest hit of a barrage of diss tracks between the two rappers.】

item.title: 柯南-奥布莱恩将于 2026 年重返奥斯卡颁奖典礼担任主持人
item.description: 美国电影艺术与科学学院（Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences）周一表示，喜剧演员、深夜电视节目主持人柯南-奥布莱恩（Conan O'Brien）将于 2026 年再次担任年度奥斯卡颁奖典礼的司仪。【原文：Comedian and late-night TV show host Conan O'Brien will return to emcee the annual Oscars ceremony for a second time in 2026, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国邮政局就零售租赁和伪造邮资问题寻求邮政总局团队的帮助
item.description: 美国邮政总局局长路易斯-德乔伊（Louis DeJoy）周一表示，他已要求埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的邮政总局团队协助审查其零售中心续租事宜，并努力打击假冒邮资等问题。【原文：U.S. Postmaster General Louis DeJoy said Monday he had asked Elon Musk's DOGE team for assistance on a review of its retail center lease renewals and efforts to combat counterfeit postage among other issues.】

item.title: "布奇和苏尼 "宇航员准备在完成九个月的任务后于周二返航
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）的两名宇航员布奇-威尔莫尔（Butch Wilmore）和苏尼-威廉姆斯（Suni Williams）已在国际空间站滞留了九个月，他们计划于周二清晨开始返回地球，踏上期待已久的回家之旅，为这次不同寻常的任务画上句号。【原文：Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, two NASA astronauts who have been stuck on the International Space Station for nine months, are scheduled to begin their return to Earth early Tuesday morning on a long-awaited flight home to cap an unusual mission.】

item.title: 美国卫生机构认为缅因州关于变性运动员的政策属于歧视行为
item.description: 美国卫生与公众服务部周一表示，已认定缅因州教育当局允许变性女孩参加学校体育活动违反了禁止性别歧视的联邦法律。【原文：The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services said on Monday that is has determined Maine educational authorities are in violation of federal law prohibiting sex discrimination by allowing transgender girls to participate in school sports.】

item.title: 特朗普最新消息：驱逐委内瑞拉人可能引发宪法冲突
item.description: 民权组织称，周末飞往萨尔瓦多的航班可能违反了法院命令。【原文：Civil rights groups said the weekend flights to El Salvador may have violated a court order.】

item.title: 参议院头号民主党人舒默因 "安全原因 "推迟新书巡展
item.description: 参议院民主党领袖查克-舒默（Chuck Schumer）在巴尔的摩图书馆的网站上发布公告称，"出于安全原因"，他推迟了 3 月 17 日这一周的巡回演讲活动。【原文：Top Senate Democrat Chuck Schumer postponed his book tour events for the week of March 17 "for security reasons," according to an announcement posted on the website of the Baltimore library where he was due to speak on Monday.】

item.title: 美国 3 月住宅建筑商信心降至七个月低点
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，由于进口材料关税提高了建筑成本，3月份美国住宅建筑商的信心降至七个月来的最低点。【原文：U.S. homebuilder sentiment dropped to a seven-month low in March as tariffs on imported materials raised construction costs, a survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: 民权组织要求对不顾法院命令驱逐委内瑞拉人一事作出答复
item.description: 民权组织要求特朗普政府 "立即澄清 "周末航班不顾法官命令将据称是委内瑞拉帮派成员驱逐出美国一事。【原文：Civil rights groups sought "immediate clarification" from the Trump administration about weekend flights deporting alleged Venezuelan gang members from the U.S. despite a judge's order.】

item.title: VIEW 2 月零售销售增幅低于预期，1 月为负值
item.description: 美国 2 月份的零售销售额出现反弹，表明第一季度经济继续增长，但由于进口关税和联邦政府大规模裁员影响了人们的情绪，增长速度有所放缓。【原文：U.S. retail sales rebounded in February, suggesting that the economy continued to grow in the first quarter, though at a moderate pace as tariffs on imports and mass firings of federal government workers weigh on sentiment.】

item.title: 纽约联储称纽约州 3 月份工厂活动骤减
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，纽约州本月的工厂活动创下近两年来的最大降幅，新订单大幅减少，投入品价格以两年多来最快的速度攀升，这是经济可能正在走弱的最新迹象。【原文：Factory activity in New York State plummeted this month by the most in nearly two years, a survey showed on Monday, with new orders falling sharply and input prices climbing at the fastest rate in more than two years in the latest sign the economy may be weakening.】

item.title: 国际奥委会巴赫表示，国际奥委会建议将拳击纳入 2028 年洛杉矶奥运会
item.description: 国际奥委会执委会周一建议将拳击纳入 2028 年洛杉矶夏季奥运会，从而结束了长达数年之久的关于拳击运动奥运前景的争论。【原文：The International Olympic Committee executive board on Monday recommended the inclusion of boxing in the Los Angeles 2028 summer Olympics, ending a years-long saga regarding the sport's Olympic future.】

item.title: WOAH 称美国自 2017 年以来首次报告农场爆发 H7N9 禽流感疫情
item.description: 世界动物卫生组织（World Organisation for Animal Health）周一援引美国当局的话说，美国报告了自 2017 年以来家禽养殖场首次爆发 H7N9 禽流感疫情。【原文：The United States reported a first outbreak of H7N9 bird flu on a poultry farm since 2017, the World Organisation for Animal Health said on Monday, citing U.S. authorities.】

item.title: 拜耳欢迎美国各州出台新法律，以更好地抵御草甘膦诉讼
item.description: 拜耳公司周一表示，欢迎美国佐治亚州即将通过的一项新法律，该法律将更好地保护作物保护化学品制造商免受草甘膦诉讼。【原文：Bayer said on Monday that it welcomed a new law about to be passed in the U.S. state of Georgia to better protect the maker of crop protection chemicals against glyphosate litigation.】

item.title: 特朗普将作为新任主席出席肯尼迪中心董事会会议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将于周一访问约翰-肯尼迪表演艺术中心（John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts），在此之前，他已经推翻了该中心的领导层，接任主席一职，并试图在这个著名的艺术机构打上自己的印记。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump will visit the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts on Monday after ousting its leadership, taking over as chair, and seeking to put his stamp on the renowned arts institution.】

item.title: 布朗大学的医生不顾美国法官的命令被驱逐回黎巴嫩
item.description: 法官要求提供信息，说明美国海关和边境保护局是否 "故意 "不服从他的命令。【原文：The judge demanded information on whether US Customs and Border Protection had 'willfully' disobeyed his order.】

item.title: 布朗大学的医生不顾美国法官的命令被驱逐回黎巴嫩
item.description: 法官要求提供信息，说明美国海关和边境保护局是否 "故意 "不服从他的命令。【原文：The judge demanded information on whether US Customs and Border Protection had 'willfully' disobeyed his order.】

item.title: 司法部反垄断局局长在政府专家组削减成本之际瞄准高价顾问
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，美国司法部新确认的反垄断执法部门负责人表示，作为唐纳德-特朗普总统削减联邦政府开支努力的一部分，她所在的部门将审查其在昂贵的经济顾问身上的花费。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice's newly confirmed head of antitrust enforcement said her division will review what it spends on expensive economic consultants as part of President Donald Trump's effort to cut costs across the federal government, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国推动俄乌停火，特朗普和普京有望本周通话
item.description: 美国特使史蒂夫-维特科夫（Steve Witkoff）周日在莫斯科与普京举行了一次他称之为 "积极的 "会谈，结束会谈后告诉美国有线电视新闻网（CNN），美国总统唐纳德-特朗普预计将于本周与俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京就结束乌克兰三年战争的方式进行会谈。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trumpis expected to speak with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putinthis week on ways to end the three-year war in Ukraine, U.S. envoy Steve Witkoff told CNN on Sunday after returning from what he described as a "positive" meeting with Putin in Moscow.】

item.title: 贝森特说 "不能保证 "美国不会出现经济衰退
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）在接受美国全国广播公司（NBC）周日播出的采访时表示，"不能保证 "美国不会出现经济衰退，但可能会有所调整。【原文：There are "no guarantees" there will not be a recession in the United States but there could be an adjustment, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in an interview with NBC that aired on Sunday.】

item.title: 人权组织提起诉讼，要求阻止特朗普驱逐支持巴勒斯坦的抗议者
item.description: 美国阿拉伯反歧视委员会（ADC）提起诉讼，质疑特朗普政府驱逐抗议或表示支持巴勒斯坦权利的留学生和学者的行为违宪。【原文：The American-Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee (ADC) filed a lawsuit challenging as unconstitutional the Trump administration’s actions to deport international students and scholars who protest or express support for Palestinian rights.】

item.title: 美国根据现已受阻的授权驱逐数百名被指控的委内瑞拉帮派成员
item.description: 美国国务卿马尔科-鲁比奥（Marco Rubio）周日表示，美国已利用现已被封锁的 1798 年《外敌法案》的授权，驱逐了数百名据称是委内瑞拉帮派特伦德阿拉瓜（Tren de Aragua）的成员。【原文：The United States has removed hundreds of alleged members of the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua using now-blocked authority from the 1798 Alien Enemies Act, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday.】

item.title: 美国根据现已受阻的授权驱逐数百名被指控的委内瑞拉帮派成员
item.description: 美国国务卿马尔科-鲁比奥（Marco Rubio）周日表示，美国已利用现已被封锁的 1798 年《外敌法案》的授权，驱逐了数百名据称是委内瑞拉帮派特伦德阿拉瓜（Tren de Aragua）的成员。【原文：The United States has removed hundreds of alleged members of the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua using now-blocked authority from the 1798 Alien Enemies Act, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday.】

item.title: 共和党人在削减开支和医疗补助问题上意见分歧，同时寻求特朗普减税政策的前进之路
item.description: 国会共和党人面临着推进唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的减税和边境安全议程的压力，他们在可以从联邦预算中削减多少开支而又不会让依赖社会安全网计划的选民陷入困境的问题上意见不一。【原文：Congressional Republicans, under pressure to move forward on President Donald Trump's tax cut and border security agenda, are at odds over how much spending they can cut from the federal budget without leaving constituents who rely on social safety net programs out in the cold.】

item.title: 洞察力：蟑螂和壁橱里的工作：特朗普复职令的内幕
item.description: 在距离美国国会大厦仅一英里的美国国家航空航天局（NASA）华盛顿总部，据两位熟悉那里情况的人士称，员工们回到总部后发现蟑螂成灾，有些人只能坐在椅子上工作，没有办公桌。【原文：At NASA headquarters in Washington, just a mile from the U.S. Capitol, employees returned to an infestation of cockroaches and some are working in chairs with no desks, according to two people familiar with conditions there.】

item.title: 宇航员机组与空间站对接，取代 "布奇和苏尼
item.description: Crew-10任务是让威尔莫尔和威廉姆斯返回地球的期待已久的第一步。两人计划于美国东部时间周三凌晨4点（格林尼治标准时间8点）离开国际空间站，同行的还有美国国家航空航天局宇航员尼克-黑格和俄罗斯宇航员亚历山大-戈尔布诺夫。【原文：The Crew-10 mission is a long-awaited first step to bring Wilmore and Williams back to Earth. The duo are scheduled to depart the ISS on Wednesday as early as 4 a.m. ET (0800 GMT), along with NASA astronaut Nick Hague and Russian cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov.】

item.title: 在俄罗斯提出抱怨后，特朗普将凯洛格的角色限定为乌克兰特使
item.description: 一些俄罗斯前高级官员抱怨说，在他们看来，凯洛格过于同情基辅。【原文：Some high-ranking former Russian officials have complained that Kellogg was, in their view, too sympathetic to Kyiv.】

item.title: 被拘留的哥伦比亚大学学生的律师要求保释
item.description: 哥伦比亚大学一名学生因支持巴勒斯坦激进主义而被拘留，他的律师在周六的保释动议中辩称，他没有潜逃风险，应获准回家生第一个孩子。【原文：A Columbia University student detained over his pro-Palestinian activism is not a flight risk and should be allowed to return home for the birth of his first child, his lawyers argued in a motion for bail on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国法官以担心战时法律为由提起诉讼，阻止部分驱逐行动
item.description: 在两个非营利组织起诉称唐纳德-特朗普总统可以援引战时法律加速驱逐无证移民后，一名联邦法官周六暂时阻止了美国政府驱逐一些委内瑞拉人。【原文：A federal judge on Saturday temporarily blocked the U.S. government from deporting some Venezuelans after two non-profit groups sued saying President Donald Trump could invoke a wartime law to accelerate deportations of undocumented migrants.】

item.title: 白宫：特朗普签署预算拨款法案使其成为法律
item.description: 白宫在一份声明中说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周六签署了国会本周通过的一项临时支出法案，避免了政府部分停摆。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday signed a stopgap spending bill, passed by Congress this week, that averts a partial government shutdown, the White House said in a statement.】
